abstract.text: Create an app extension that lets users report unwanted SMS messages and calls as junk.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: To report SMS messages and calls as spam, the user must enable an Unwanted Communication Reporting extension, called an SMS/Call Reporting extension in the Settings app (see Settings > Phone > SMS/Call Reporting). The user can only enable one Unwanted Communication Reporting extension at a time.

In order to report calls, the user swipes left on an item in the Recents list and selects Report. For SMS messages, they press the Report Messages button when it appears in the Messages transcript. Users can also select messages by long-pressing a message and selecting additional messages, then selecting Report Messages.

When the user reports an SMS message or call, the system launches your Unwanted Communication Reporting extension. Your extension gathers additional information from the user, before deciding whether to report or block the number, as shown in the figure below.
Specifically, the system:
Instantiates your extension’s
subclass.
Calls your controller’s
method and presents the controller to the user.
Use your
subclass to gather data from the user. Override the
method to configure your controller.

The system provides a Cancel and a Done button for the controller. By default, the system disables the Done button. As soon as the user has entered all the information you require, enable the Done button by setting the view controller’s
property to
If the user presses the Cancel button, the system dismisses your view controller, as shown in the figure below.
If the user presses Done, the system calls your view controller’s
method, passing in an
object (see the figure below).

method to return a
based on the data the user has entered and information about the SMS message or call from the request object.
The system takes different actions based on the response. For

To send a response over the network connection, you must add an associated domain to your extension. For general instructions, see

To send your response using SMS, specify a fully qualified destination telephony number using the
key in your extension’s
file. When your app uses this report path, the system displays the SMS message to give the user the opportunity to send or cancel the message.
When the report step is complete, the system dismisses your view controller and any view controllers related to it (see the figure below).
For
, the system responds just like in the

action. However, after the report step, the system presents an alert letting the user know the number will be blocked. Finally, the system blocks the SMS or call number, and dismisses your view controller as shown in the figure below.
Blocked numbers are added to the device’s Blocked Contact list. Users can manage this list in the Settings app.
Finally, to protect user privacy, the system always deletes your extension’s container after your extension terminates. For more information, see

abstract.text: Connect your app and a website to provide both a native app and a browser experience.
A true value.
Create app extensions to manage and report unwanted SMS messages and spam calls.
A classification request for phone calls.
A concrete subclass representing a  phone call.
The actions the system can take in response to the reported communication.
No action is required.
The system should report the communication as junk.
The system should report the communication as junk and add the number to the system’s block list.
The system should report that the communication is not junk.
The abstract superclass for classification requests.
A response object that tells the system how to handle the reported communications.
A classification that determines what action the system takes.
JSON data included in a response sent over the network.
An abstract superclass representing a message or call to the user.
A classification request for SMS messages.
A concrete subclass representing a SMS message.
A set of methods implemented by a Message Filter app extension to handle capabilities query requests.
A request to query a Message Filter extension about sharing its sub-category capabilities.
A response to a message filter capabilities query request.
Responds to a received message with a filter subaction.
A Boolean value that determines whether the extension has enough information to complete the report.
The superclass for an Unwanted Communication Reporting extension’s principal view controller.
Notifies the view controller when the user finishes entering data and presses the Done button.
Notifies the view controller just before the system presents it to the user.

media-3012154.alt: An illustration showing the system instantiating and displaying your view controller in response to the user reporting an SMS message or call.

media-3025725.alt: A circle representing the System Response with a right-facing arrow that points to a device with Cancel or Send buttons. That device has a right-facing arrow that points to a rectangle representing an extension with a view controller with Cancel and Send buttons. That extension has a right-facing arrow that points to a rectangle representing an extension with Deleted for user privacy text. Below that is a dark version of the same diagram.

media-3025729.alt: An illustration showing the user tapping the Done button after entering all the required information in your user interface.

media-3025730.alt: An illustration showing the user cancelling your view controller.

media-3025734.alt: A circle representing the System Response with a right-facing arrow that points to a device with Cancel or Send buttons. That device has a right-facing arrow that points to another device showing Alert SMS/Call blocked text. That device has a right-facing arrow that points to a rectangle representing an extension with a view controller dismissed. That extension has a right-facing arrow that points to a rectangle representing an extension with Deleted for user privacy text. Below that is a dark version of the same diagram.

media-3025747.alt: A circle representing the System Response with a right-facing arrow that points to a rectangle representing an extension with view controller dismissed. That extension has a right-facing arrow that points to a rectangle representing an extension with Deleted for user privacy text. Below that is a dark version of the same diagram.
